explanation: Sends repeated magic packets to ensure wake across unreliable network paths (common for WOL). Detection: identify repeated WOL attempts to the same MAC and unusual persistence of UDP port 9 traffic from an admin session; UAC elevation may be required depending on local policy.
rationale_steps: Invoke WakeMeOnLan five times to increase wake reliability.
Each invocation constructs the 0xFF*6 + MAC*16 magic packet.
Short delay helps mitigate loss or filtering.
Detect via network telemetry for repeated UDP 9 broadcasts and host-based logging of the tool execution.
